name: C-Pop
description: Commercialized style performed by Chinese communities across China and Taiwan, alongside its large diaspora.

children.name: Cantopop
children.description: Modern commercial Pop music sung in the Cantonese language, usually produced in Hong Kong or adjacent regions.

children.name: Gufeng
children.description: Emphasizes Chineseness and an "ancient" atmosphere, and often features semi-classical lyrics.

children.name: Hokkien Pop
children.description: Modern Pop music sung in Hokkien dialects, with its industry largely centered across Taiwan and Southeast Asia.

children.name: Mandopop
children.description: C-Pop in which songs are performed in Mandarin.

children.name: Zhongguo feng
children.description: Inspired by traditional elements of Chinese Music with lyrical themes constantly revolving around Chinese culture and tales.
